title: And in the End..., The Bootleg Beatles and RLPO, Royal Albert Hall: less like a tribute than a reincarnation
text:
And In The End … was billed as a 50th-anniversary celebration of the final Beatles albums, Abbey Road and Let It Be. But the title (a quote from Abbey Road) is a misnomer. There is no end to the Beatles in sight. Earlier this month, Abbey Road itself returned to the top of the British charts, a demonstration of the apparently bottomless appetite for anything to do with the Sixties superstars.

Five decades since they broke up, here amid another century’s digital beats streaming from handheld computers whilst stars communicate in a semaphore of selfies, this old analogue rock band remain tangibly present in pop culture. You can hear them on hit movie soundtracks, see their faces on T-shirts and...
description: And In The End … was billed as a 50th-anniversary celebration of the final Beatles albums, Abbey Road and Let It Be.
